resources.string: Solve for x,y such as axy+bx+cy=d where a,b,c,d,x,y ∊ ℤ with a ≠ 0.
Compute the Greatest Common Divisor (GCD) of two numbers a and b. The GCD is the largest number that divides both a and b without leaving a remainder.
Solve for x,y such as ax+by = gcd(a, b) where a,b ∊ ℕ, x,y ∊ ℤ.
Linear Diophantine Equation In Two Variables
Solve for x,y such as ax+by=c where a,b,c,x,y ∊ ℤ with a,b ≠ 0.
Solve for x, a congruence of the form ax ≡ b (mod m) where a,b,x ∊ ℤ, m ∊ ℕ.
Solve for x,y a congruence of the form ax+by ≡ c (mod m) where a,b,c,x,y ∊ ℤ, m ∊ ℕ.
Solve for x a congruence of the form x² ≡ a (mod p), where p ∊ PRIMES.
Find n ≡ bc (mod a) where (ax+c)(ay+b) = a(axy+bx+cy)+bc = n.
List of primes ordered in columns.
